cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast (FL Panhandle/AL) and then curving north-northeast into the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic late Tue–Wed
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near the Florida Panhandle or Alabama coast

weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of the Seven Mile Bridge to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, eastern Gulf Coast, Florida Panhandle, Alabama and adjacent northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds (generally 20–30 mph) possible as remnant low passes inland west of Delaware
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Delaware Bay/River from Fred’s inland track
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible, locally higher if the core remnant passes closer
weather_observation.other_hazards: Urban and small-stream flooding could disrupt terminal trucking and rail access
